Outlander.description: Outlander follows the story of Claire Randall, a World War II combat nurse who is mysteriously transported back in time to 18th century Scotland, where she becomes entangled in the Jacobite risings and a passionate love story with a Highland warrior.
Outlander.author: Diana Gabaldon

Rich Dad Poor Dad.image: /imgs/Books/Rich Dad Poor Dad (Robert Kiyosaki)/Rich Dad Poor Dad.jpg
Rich Dad Poor Dad.description: Rich Dad Poor Dad explores the differences between two fathers – one wealthy and one poor – and how their approaches to money and life shaped the author's financial understanding. It offers life-changing lessons on financial independence and investing.
Rich Dad Poor Dad.author: Robert Kiyosaki

To Kill a Mockingbird.image: /imgs/Books/To kill a Mockingbird (Harper Lee)/To kill a Mockingbird.jpg
To Kill a Mockingbird.description: Set in the Depression-era South, To Kill a Mockingbird follows young Scout Finch as she witnesses her father, lawyer Atticus Finch, defend a black man accused of raping a white woman, exploring themes of racial injustice, moral complexity, and coming of age.
To Kill a Mockingbird.author: Harper Lee

Becoming.description: A deeply personal memoir by Michelle Obama, chronicling her roots in Chicago, her journey through Princeton and Harvard, her professional career, and her time as First Lady of the United States.
Becoming.author: Michelle Obama

The Catcher in the Rye.image: /imgs/Books/The Catcher in the Rye (J.D. Salinger)/The Catcher in the Rye.jpg
The Catcher in the Rye.description: The Catcher in the Rye narrates the life of Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager in New York City who is grappling with the pain of growing up and the complexities of adult society.
The Catcher in the Rye.author: J.D. Salinger

The Secret.description: The Secret reveals the law of attraction, explaining how positive thinking and visualization can transform one's life. The book argues that by focusing on positive thoughts, individuals can attract wealth, health, and happiness, offering a philosophy of personal empowerment and manifestation.
The Secret.author: Rhonda Byrne

The Sand Child.description: A powerful novel exploring gender identity and societal expectations in Morocco, The Sand Child tells the story of Ahmed/Fatima, a girl raised as a boy to fulfill her father's desire for a male heir. The narrative delves into complex themes of gender, identity, and cultural constraints.
The Sand Child.author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

War and Peace.image: /imgs/Books/War and Peace (Leo Tolstoy)/War and Peace (Leo Tolstoy).jpg
War and Peace.description: An epic novel that intertwines the lives of Russian aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Era, exploring themes of love, war, history, and the philosophical meaning of life.
War and Peace.author: Leo Tolstoy

The Alchemist.description: The Alchemist is an inspiring tale of Santiago, a shepherd boy who embarks on a journey to find a treasure hidden in the Egyptian pyramids, learning valuable life lessons about following one's dreams and listening to one's heart.
The Alchemist.author: Paulo Coelho

The Great Gatsby.image: /imgs/Worl Books/The Great Gatsby (F. Scott Fitzgerald)/The Great Gatsby.jpg
The Great Gatsby.description: Set in the Roaring Twenties, The Great Gatsby explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream through the eyes of Nick Carraway, a young man who is drawn into the world of his mysterious neighbor, Jay Gatsby.
The Great Gatsby.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

The Hobbit.description: The Hobbit is a high fantasy adventure that follows Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the Lonely Mountain and its treasure from the dragon Smaug. Along the way, he encounters trolls, elves, goblins, and an enchanted ring.
The Hobbit.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
